full_summary:
# Okanagan Chinook Life History Research
## Request for Proposal (RFP)
**Solicitation Number:** 30004719/A  
**Publication Date:** November 21, 2023  
**Tender Closing Date:** December 1, 2023, 13:00:00  
 
The Department of Fisheries and Oceans Canada (DFO) invites qualified registrered Indigenous Business to submit a proposal for a PSIB Voluntary set-aside. The contractor will provide ecological science services for Okanagan Chinook Life History Research. 

**Scope of Work:**
The contractor will:

1. Distribute funds and provide guidance to research
  a) Spatial and temporal habitat use by Chinook salmon in the Canadian Okanagan Watershed  
  b) Predation on juvenile Chinook salmon by native and non-native fishes in the Canadian Okanagan Watershed

2. Review research questions with DFO prior to finalization, as well as the research study design for feedback and iterative development.

3. Provide field support and equipment in the Okanagan Watershed as required.

**Security Requirement:**
This contract is not subject to any security requirements.

**Period of Contract:**
March 5, 2024, to March 31, 2025.

**Trade Agreements:**
This requirement is not subject to Trade Agreements as it is a set-aside.

**Contracting Entity:**
Department of Fisheries and Oceans Canada.  
Contact Information:  
Jackie Longmire  
506-471-1717  
Jackie.Longmire@dfo-mpo.gc.ca 

### Documents

Please refer to the RFP document for further details. 

To access the document, please visit the following link: [https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/25433/30004719a--rfp%28en.pdf](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/25433/30004719a--rfp%28en.pdf)
 

This is a professional announcement of a request for proposal, centered around the Okanagan Chinook Life History Research project. 

Note that the rewritten text has been streamlined to include a clear and concise summary of the tender, along with essential details. The output adheres to a formal tone and follows standard federal tender guidelines. The bioscychomematic language used is encouraged to facilitate an easier translation.
